summary: Completed frontend testing of finHealth quiz app. All major flows working: landing page, 8-question quiz flow, results page with score/pillars/chart/emergency fund/action items, workshop form validation and graceful error handling.

ui_bugs.issue: No element with role='progressbar' or class containing 'progress' found - may be using a custom div. Not functionally broken but reduces accessibility.

When score is 100/100, action items still show generic improvement suggestions (e.g. 'Increase savings rate') since all pillars tie and sort order is deterministic but arbitrary. Minor UX: user with perfect score gets confusing 'improvement' tips.

integration_issues.issue: Shows 'Something went wrong. Please try again.' - expected since Supabase 'leads' table not created yet. Error is handled gracefully (correct behavior per requirements).

issues: Framer-motion animations cause content to appear faded in early screenshots; not a real issue - content is visible after animation completes.

action_items: Create Supabase 'leads' table using SQL from docs to enable workshop form submissions
Optional: Add role='progressbar' to progress bar for accessibility
critical_code_review_comments: Progress bar in question-view.tsx lacks role='progressbar' - add for a11y
Workshop form shows error gracefully - this is correct behavior when Supabase table doesn't exist
Scoring logic is correctly deterministic - same answers produce same score (verified: 100/100 for all optimal answers)
No data-testid on progress bar, back button in question view
context_for_next_testing_agent: All quiz flows tested and working. Supabase leads table not yet created - workshop form shows graceful error. Progress bar uses custom div (no ARIA role). Logo reset tested and working. Score is deterministic (100/100 for optimal answers). All 8 questions verified with correct options.
